CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 4,5 Nevertheless , most of these side - chain D-A conjugated polymers did not exhibit comparable device performance to their main - chain D-A counterpart polymers. In order to develop high - performance side - chain D-A conjugated polymers , it is necessary to develop new catalog of side - chain D-A polymers for efficient PSCs. Given that benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene ( BDT ) unit has a large planar molecular structure by fusing a benzene with two flanking thiophenyl units and diketopyrrolopyrrole ( DPP ) , i.e. , pyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4(2H,5H)-dione unit has a well conjugated structure with strong π-π interaction and electron - withdrawing effect , some main - chain D-A copolymers based on DPP or / and BDT units as prime building block had been designed for optoelectronic applications in both thin - film transistors and solar cells in recent years. 6 It is worthy to note that PSCs based on these copolymers with a tandem structure showed an increasing PCE of 8.62% . 2a Here we report another novel sidechain D-A conjugated copolymer ( PBDT-TDPP-S ) for highperformance PSCs , in which the BDT and thiophene units are conjugatedly formed the main chain and the di(thiophen-2yl)pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4(2H,5H)-dione ( TDPP ) units are pended onto the thiophenyl units to build the side chain by a linkage of a 2-vinylthiophenyl unit. Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and PC71BM as electron acceptor , the resulting PSCs exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a PCE of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.84 V , a shortcircuit current ( J SC ) of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor ( FF ) of 56.0% . To our best knowledge , the efficiency is among the highest reported to date for side - chain D-A conjugated copolymers and is twice higher than that of the main - chain D-A counterpart polymer PBDTDPP-OR in the single BHJ PSCs. synthesized by a common Stille coupling reaction using Pd(PPh 3 ) 4 as catalyst with a high yield of 78.7% , as shown in Scheme 1. For comparison , the corresponding main - chain D-A conjugated copolymer of PBDT - DPP was made at the same time. The resulting PBDT-TDPP-S showed good solubility in common organic solvents , such as chlorobenzene , o-dichlorobenzene , and dichloromethane ( DCM ) , but PBDT - DPP was nearly not soluble in them. Gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) analysis showed that PBDT-TDPP-S has a numberaverage molecular weight ( M n ) of 1.34 × 10^4 g mol^-1 with a polydispersity index of 1.27 ( Figure S1 ). Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) indicated that PBDT-TDPP-S has high thermal stability with a degradation temperature ( T d ) of 364 °C at 5% weight loss. The corresponding molecular weights and thermal properties of PBDT-TDPP-S are summarized in Table 1 , and the recorded TGA curve is shown in Figure S2 ( see Supporting Information ) . The UV - vis absorption spectra of PBDT-TDPP-S in DCM solution and solid film are shown in Figure 1a.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |
| PBDT-DPP |
| BDT |
| DPP |
| PSCs |
| PC71BM |
| Pd(PPh3)4 |
| Chlorobenzene |
| o-Dichlorobenzene |
| Dichloromethane (DCM) |
| Gel permeation chromatography (GPC) |
| Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) |
| UV-vis absorption spectra |

Note: PBDT-TDPP-S, PBDT-DPP, BDT, and DPP are all polymers, but they are referred to as "materials" in the context of the paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |
| PBDT-DPP |
| BDT |
| DPP |
| PC71BM |

Note:

* PBDT-TDPP-S, PBDT-DPP, BDT, and DPP are all referred to as "materials" in the paragraph and are clearly identified as such.
* PC71BM is also referred to as a material in the paragraph, specifically as an electron acceptor in the construction of PSCs.
* The other entities mentioned in the paragraph (Pd(PPh3)4, chlorobenzene, o-dichlorobenzene, dichloromethane, gel permeation chromatography, and thermogravimetric analysis) are not clearly referred to as materials, and thus are not included in the table.

Paragraph: 4,5 Nevertheless , most of these side - chain D-A conjugated polymers did not exhibit comparable device performance to their main - chain D-A counterpart polymers. In order to develop high - performance side - chain D-A conjugated polymers , it is necessary to develop new catalog of side - chain D-A polymers for efficient PSCs. To our best knowledge , the efficiency is among the highest reported to date for side - chain D-A conjugated copolymers and is twice higher than that of the main - chain D-A counterpart polymer PBDTDPP-OR in the single BHJ PSCs. synthesized by a common Stille coupling reaction using Pd(PPh 3 ) 4 as catalyst with a high yield of 78.7% , as shown in Scheme 1. For comparison , the corresponding main - chain D-A conjugated copolymer of PBDT - DPP was made at the same time. The resulting PBDT-TDPP-S showed good solubility in common organic solvents , such as chlorobenzene , o-dichlorobenzene , and dichloromethane ( DCM ) , but PBDT - DPP was nearly not soluble in them. Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) indicated that PBDT-TDPP-S has high thermal stability with a degradation temperature ( T d ) of 364 °C at 5% weight loss. The corresponding molecular weights and thermal properties of PBDT-TDPP-S are summarized in Table 1 , and the recorded TGA curve is shown in Figure S2 ( see Supporting Information ) . The UV - vis absorption spectra of PBDT-TDPP-S in DCM solution and solid film are shown in Figure 1a.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene (BDT) |
| pyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4(2H,5H)-dione (DPP) |

| 2-vinylthiophenyl |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |
| PC71BM |
| PBDT-DPP |

Note: PBDT-TDPP-S and PBDT-DPP are not actual property names, but rather the names of specific polymers that are composed of the mentioned building blocks.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 4.89% | PCE (power conversion efficiency) of PSCs based on PBDT-TDPP-S |
| 0.84 V | VOC (open-circuit voltage) of PSCs based on PBDT-TDPP-S |
| 10.04 mA cm^-2 | JSC (short-circuit current) of PSCs based on PBDT-TDPP-S |
| 56.0% | FF (fill factor) of PSCs based on PBDT-TDPP-S |
| 1.34 × 10^4 g mol^-1 | Number-average molecular weight (Mn) of PBDT-TDPP-S |
| 1.27 | Polydispersity index of PBDT-TDPP-S |
| 364 °C | Td (degradation temperature) of PBDT-TDPP-S at 5% weight loss |

Note: The units for the molecular weight and polydispersity index are not explicitly stated in the given paragraph, but they are commonly expressed in units of g/mol and dimensionless, respectively.
